courseDetails.defination: What is HTML? HTML is the standard language used to create web pages. It defines the structure of a webpage using a system of elements (tags). These elements tell the browser how to display the content.

keyConcept.concept:
Elements & Tags: HTML documents are made up of elements wrapped in tags like , ,

, etc.
Attributes: Tags can have attributes that provide additional information about an element. Common attributes include id, class, src, and href.
Headings: HTML provides six levels of headings, <h1> to <h6>, with <h1> being the most important.

Paragraphs: The

tag is used to create paragraphs in HTML.
